str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Trans: I bring near; intrans: I come near, approach. From eggus; to make near, i.e. approach.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Jericho, a city a little north of the Dead Sea. Of Hebrew origin; Jericho, a place in Palestine.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
Blind, physically or mentally. From, tuphoo; opaque, i.e. blind.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To sit, be seated, enthroned; I dwell, reside. From kata; and hemai; to sit down; figuratively, to remain, reside.
Gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A way, road, journey, path. Apparently a primary word; a road; by implication, a progress; figuratively, a mode or means.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To beg, be a beggar, ask alms. From epi and aiteo; to ask for.
